page.title: 03CENSUS DATA ON SHREWLEY
page.content: The following data is taken from the 1981 Census Enumeration. The infor- mation refers only to RQAT01 and RQAT04 of Ward 18 of that Census. Population structure: A large propor- tion of young and old people make up the population, 20% being aged under 16 years and a further 20% being aged 60 or over. Employment: From the 10% sample taken in the Census (40 people), none were employed in agriculture whereas about half were employed in SERVICES and a quarter in MANUFACTURING. There is no direct evidence of the number in the sample who commute to work outside this area, though 85% travelled to work by private car. Social class: The 10% sample used in the Census showed the following composition of SOCIO-ECONOMIC groups: I 6%, II 4%, III 28%, IV 20% and V 6%.
